H0.text: A winter storm that produces frozen precipitation is a description that best describes a tornado.

H1.text: A rotating funnel-shaped cloud with strong winds and thunderstorms is a tornado.

H2.text: A severe weather condition with low temperatures and blowing snow is what best describes a tornado.

H3.text: A storm that forms over warm ocean water and has extremely strong winds best describes a tornado.

A4.text: Tornadoes are often (but not always) visible in the form of a condensation funnel originating from the cloud base, with a cloud of rotating debris and dust close to the ground.

A5.text: A tornado is a rapidly rotating column of air that extends vertically from the surface of the Earth to the base of a cumulonimbus or cumulus cloud.
